message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

The paper proposes a deep convolutional neural network for anomaly detection in surveillance videos. This involves learning a correspondence between common object appearances and their associated motions. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves training the model using only videos of normal events, which suggests the use of machine learning techniques such as deep learning. This makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. Additionally, the paper deals with video sequences, which falls under the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper deals with surveillance videos, which may involve security and privacy concerns, making cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) a possible sub-category as well.
